intro: Hylotelephium borderei, commonly known as the Armenian rock玫瑰, is a perennial succulent native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It features fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically green with a reddish tinge, especially under stress. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in dense clusters during the summer months. It is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Hylotelephium borderei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its striking appearance and hardy nature.
